resources.string: wile sina pi lipu ni
lukin musi
nasin lukin pi tawa ijo
ante pi nanpa ijo
o lukin e pali pini
o lukin e pali ken
o lukin e nimi pi lon mute
lipu pi pali pi musi ni
nasin sitelen pi tawa ijo
sitelen pi ijo musi
sitelen nimi (K, Q, R, B, N)

string.name: zenMode
string.comment:
zenMode
This is not the religious meaning. Turning this option on takes away make elements of the user interface.
Can also translate as 'Focus mode' as one example.

resources.string: nasin pi pilin pona
o pana lukin e ilo pi ante suli pi supa musi
lon tenpo open taso
ijo musi pi lukin ala
ilo tenpo
tenpo lili kipisi pi luka luka

string.name: whenTimeRemainingLessThanTenSeconds
string.comment:
whenTimeRemainingLessThanTenSeconds
The < symbol is not required (you can write it as a word), just do NOT use < in its place.
Technical information: < is a reserved character in HTML, which is why it cannot be used.

resources.string: tenpo lili awen li luka luka anu mute lili la
laso jelo
tenpo li lili la o kalama
o pana e tenpo

string.name: gameBehavior
string.comment:
gameBehavior
In the user settings page, "Game behavior" is the title of the tab for configuring how the player can interact with the game.

resources.string: nasin pali musi
sina tawa seme e ijo?
o pilin e selo tu
o tawa e ijo
ale
tawa lon tenpo kama (sina tawa e ijo tenpo sama la jan ante li musi)
o weka e tawa (la jan ante li pilin pona)
taso lon musi pi nanpa ala
o kama e lawa meli la ilo sona li tawa
tenpo sama la jan li pilin e tawa pi tenpo kama
tawa li sama lon tawa tu wan la o sama e musi
tenpo tawa li lili tawa tenpo Sekunta 30
sina wile tawa la o sina wile toki e ni pi tenpo tu
musi pi tenpo suli
musi pi tenpo suli en musi pi tenpo ale
o toki e ni: sina wile pini ike anu sina wile sama e musi
o tawa e tomo utala, e jan lawa lon tenpo tawa sama kepeken nasin seme?
o tawa e lawa mije lon ma pi weka tu
o tawa e jan lawa tawa ma pi tomo utala
ilo sitelen la sina sitelen e pali

string.name: snapArrowsToValidMoves
string.comment:
snapArrowsToValidMoves
The 'arrows' are for quick annotations you can do on the board, by holding right mouse button. With this setting enabled, it means the arrows will align themselves to places were pieces can move.

resources.string: mi sitelen e palisa lon supa musi la, o pali ala pali e ni: palisa li nasin tawa tawa ken taso?

string.name: sayGgWpAfterLosingOrDrawing
string.comment:
sayGgWpAfterLosingOrDrawing
When enabled, this setting will automatically send 'Good game, well played' to your opponent if you are lose or draw the game. It's meant as a courtesy message.
The message will be sent in ENGLISH.
It is up to you how to deal with this. For example, you may want to put '(message will be sent in English)' in your translated text as one example. Or you can leave the actual English text and put a brief translation in your own language.

resources.string: mi pini ike anu pini pi anpa ala e musi la, o toki \"musi pona, sina pona\" (toki Inli)
wile sina li awen.
